name: Basic Turtle Position and Defense
description: Learn to maintain turtle position safely and defend against common attacks while looking for escape opportunities.

name: Clock Choke (from Turtle)
description: Effective gi choke from the turtle position. Teaches important concepts of grip fighting and pressure.

name: Butterfly Guard Sweeps
description: Develop powerful sweeping options from butterfly guard using hooks, off-balancing, and grips.

name: Basic Rubber Guard Concepts
description: Introduction to rubber guard positions for flexibility and control from bottom guard.

name: Leg Drag Pass
description: A fundamental and powerful open guard pass. Focus on controlling the legs and upper body to pass to side control.

name: Ezekiel Choke from Mount
description: Gi choke from mount using sleeve grip. Practice proper angle and pressure application.

name: X-Guard Entries and Basics
description: Introduction to X-guard entries from seated guard and basic sweep mechanics.

name: Basic North-South Position
description: Learn to achieve and maintain north-south position with proper weight distribution and control.

name: D'Arce Choke Fundamentals
description: Introduction to the D'Arce choke from front headlock positions, such as after a sprawl or from knee-on-belly.

name: Closed Guard Sweep Series (advanced)
description: More advanced variations of closed guard sweeps and sequencing. Combine scissor, hip bump and lapel-assisted sweeps into continuous movement.

name: X-Guard Entries & Sweeps
description: Intro to X-guard entries, posture control and basic sweeps. Focus on balance disruption and safe entries from standing or seated positions.

name: Knee Slice Pass (pressure pass)
description: Pressure-based guard pass that isolates a knee and slices through. Emphasize posture, shoulder pressure and leg control to avoid sweeps.

name: Standing Guard Passing Concepts
description: Dynamic passing from standing focusing on grips, posture and leg control. Integrate toreando and knee-cut passes into flow drills.

name: Bow and Arrow Choke (collar choke)
description: Back control finishing option using a deep collar grip. Train safe set-up, seatbelt control and smooth choke mechanics.

name: Lasso Guard Fundamentals
description: Introduction to lasso guard control using sleeve and foot positioning for sweeps and submissions.

name: Crucifix Control and Submissions
description: Advanced control position trapping both arms and setting up chokes and armlocks.

name: Deep Half Guard System
description: Advanced half guard variation focusing on underhooks and back attacks from deep half position.

name: De La Riva Guard Sweeps & Entries
description: Use De La Riva hook to off-balance and sweep opponents. Drill entries, grip fighting and transitions to back-takes or leg attacks.

name: North-South Escapes & Controls
description: Escapes and control options from north-south position focusing on frames and hip movement. Include reversals and safe recovery sequences.

name: Leg Lock Fundamentals (entry and control)
description: Foundational straight ankle and kneebar entries from seated and open positions. Stress control, safety and progression rather than high-level finishing on beginners.

name: Inverted Guard Basics
description: Introduction to inverted guard positions and basic sweeps while maintaining safety and control.

name: Reverse De La Riva to Back Take
description: Transitions from leg entanglement controls to safe back takes. Practice hand control, hooks and seatbelt transitions for secure back control.

name: Worm Guard Introduction
description: Basic concepts of worm guard using lapel control for advanced guard retention and attacking.

name: 50/50 Guard Entries and Retention
description: Understand the basic positions, controls, and dangers of the 50/50 leg entanglement.

name: K-Guard System
description: Advanced guard system using knee shield and lapel grips for sweeps and back takes.

name: Advanced Guard Passing Chains
description: High-level chaining of passes mixing knee slice, torreando and leg-weave to break complex guards. Emphasize pressure, timing and reaction to counters.

name: Berimbolo Variations
description: Advanced inversion and back-take entries from guard progressing to back control. Focus on timing, hip mobility and balance to safely invert.

name: Advanced Leg Lock Chains
description: Chains connecting ankle, knee and calf-control positions leading to submissions. Drill safe entries, positional control and step-by-step progression for finishing.

name: Collar Tie & Russian Tie Takedowns
description: Advanced standing grappling concepts using head and arm control to set up trips and throws.

name: Back Step Pass
description: A versatile and dynamic passing technique to circumvent strong guard defenses.

name: Matrix System (Advanced Lapel Guards)
description: Complex lapel guard system incorporating multiple guard positions and transitions.

name: High Level Transitions and Flow
description: Seamless transitions between multiple positions maintaining constant pressure and control.

name: Pressure & Positional Dominance
description: Advanced control using bodyweight and angles to neutralize opponents. Refinement of small details that maintain top pressure and energy efficiency.

name: High-Level Submission Chains
description: Combining transitions and submissions into fluid chains for high-level control. Emphasis on finishes, counters and teaching points for advanced practitioners.

name: Teaching Drill: Progressive Resistance
description: How to structure drills that progressively increase resistance for learning. Focus on coaching cues, level progression and safe intensity control.

name: Advanced Competition Strategy
description: Strategic thinking for high-level competition including game planning, psychological preparation and tactical adjustments.

name: Injury Prevention and Longevity
description: Methods for maintaining joint health, preventing common BJJ injuries and adapting training for different life phases.

name: Advanced Teaching Methodology
description: Sophisticated teaching approaches for different learning styles and skill levels.

name: System Refinement & Philosophy
description: High-level principles and refinement of personal systems and pedagogy. Focus on principles that are transferable across students and generations.

name: Legacy Teaching Methods
description: Structuring a lineage and curriculum for future instructors. Covers how to maintain quality and safety while propagating technique over decades.

name: Mastery Drill: Pressure, Pace & Longevity
description: Training methods for longevity and sustainable practice across a lifetime. Includes recovery, drill pacing and adapted intensity for older athletes.

name: Grandmaster Wisdom and Leadership
description: Developing leadership qualities in the martial arts community and passing on the philosophical aspects of BJJ to future generations.

name: Technical Stand Up
description: Fundamental movement to safely return to standing from seated. Practice focus on balance, base and controlled posture when rising.

name: Hip Escape (Shrimping)
description: Basic movement to create space and reposition guard. Emphasize fast hip movement and shoulder placement to recover guard under pressure.

name: Breakfall
description: Learn to fall safely and prevent injury. Includes backward, forward and side breakfalls with proper chin tuck and arm slapping.

name: Bridge and Hip Movement
description: Fundamental bridging movement for escapes and creating space. Essential for mount and side control escapes.

name: Basic Guard Position
description: Learn to maintain closed guard position with proper posture control and basic grips.

name: Elbow Escape (Mount Escape)
description: Escape from mount by creating frames and recovering half guard or full guard. Drill bridging, hip escape and trap sequences to consistently regain guard.

name: Bridge and Roll Escape
description: Escape from mount by bridging and trapping arm and leg. Emphasize timing to trap a limb and roll to recover top position or guard.

name: Guard Retention - Hip Escape and Frame
description: Maintain guard by framing against pressure and shrimping back to recover. Combine frames with active footwork to prevent passing attempts.

name: Basic Mount Control
description: Learn to maintain and control mount position with proper weight distribution and base.

name: Side Control Escape - Shrimp to Guard
description: Use hip movement and frames to escape side control and recover guard. Practice re-creating frames to escape under heavy pressure and re-guard effectively.

name: Knee Shield Escape & Transition
description: Advanced knee-shield concepts to create space and transition to sweeps or standups. Practice combining knee shield retention with timely grips and angle changes.

name: Standing Base & Safe Takedown Defense
description: Defensive posture and sprawl timing to stop basic takedowns. Train safe re-shots and recoveries leading into guard or underhooks.

name: Closed Guard to Open Guard Flow
description: Drills to safely open closed guard, create frames and transition to open guard options. Emphasis on posture, grips and smooth guard recovery sequences.

name: Forward Roll (Ukemi)
description: Fundamental rolling breakfall to disperse impact and recover to standing. Essential for safe practice of throws and takedowns.

name: Trap and Roll Escape (Mount)
description: Basic but highly effective mount escape using an arm trap and a strong bridge to unbalance the opponent.

name: Americana from Mount
description: Submission from mount using figure-four grip on opponent's arm. Work on shoulder isolation and safe, incremental pressure to finish the lock.

name: Scissor Sweep
description: Basic sweep from closed guard using shin to off-balance the opponent. Work on timing, grips and knee placement to smoothly transition to mount or top position.

name: Hip Bump Sweep
description: Sweep from closed guard by bumping hips to sit up and clear a side. Focus on posture break, underhook and explosive hip elevation to execute the sweep.

name: Pummeling Drill for Underhooks
description: Develop the muscle memory for securing underhooks in the clinch, crucial for takedowns and takedown defense.

name: Armbar from Guard
description: Submission from guard that hyperextends the opponent's elbow. Drill the set-ups, angle change and leg positioning for a tight, controlled finish.

name: Kimura from Guard
description: Submission from closed guard using a double wrist grip and shoulder control. Focus on grip transitions and hip movement to secure the lock safely.

name: Closed Guard Pass - Knee in Tailbone
description: Open the closed guard with a strong posture and controlled break. Learn the knee-in-tailbone posture break and safe pass mechanics to avoid sweeps or submissions.

name: Basic Side Control
description: Learn to maintain side control with proper cross-face, underhook and weight distribution.

name: Double Leg Takedown
description: Takedown by grabbing both legs and driving forward. Focus on level change, head position and finishing mechanics to complete the takedown safely.

name: Collar Sleeve Guard Control
description: Introduction to open guard. Learn to control distance and posture using a collar and sleeve grip.

name: Single Leg Takedown
description: Fundamental wrestling takedown. Drill the finish from various grips and positions.

name: Back Escape - Over the Shoulder
description: Escape from back control by clearing the hooks and turning in. Drill hand-fighting, escaping hooks and getting knees to the mat for recovery.

name: Osoto Gari
description: Judo-style takedown by sweeping the opponent's leg while controlling upper body. Train entries from collar-and-sleeve grip and posture break prior to the sweep.

name: Triangle Choke
description: Strangle the opponent using legs while controlling posture and arm. Work on breaking posture, angle creation and squeezing mechanics for a reliable finish.

name: Omaplata from Guard
description: Shoulder lock submission from guard using the leg. Focus on hip movement and angle creation to finish.

name: Tripod Sweep
description: Sweep using hooks and opponent's weight distribution while seated. Emphasize foot placement and off-balancing to bring opponent forward and topple them.

name: Toreando Pass
description: Standing pass using grips on knees or pants to redirect legs and pass. Practice balance, timing and footwork to smoothly offload the opponent's leg pressure.

name: Rear Naked Choke
description: Choke from back control by locking the arm behind opponent's head. Emphasize proper hand placement and chest-to-back pressure to finish quickly and safely.

name: Knee on Belly Control
description: Dominant position using knee pressure on opponent's torso while maintaining base and control.

name: Basic Back Control
description: Learn to maintain back control with seatbelt grip and proper hook placement.

name: Spider Guard Basics
description: Learn to use feet on biceps to control the opponent's arms and create off-balancing and sweep opportunities.

name: Loop Choke from Standing
description: Aggressive gi choke that can be hit from standing, in the clinch, or when someone is trying to pass your guard.

name: Guard Recovery from Side Control
description: Advanced techniques for recovering guard from difficult side control positions using frames and hip movement.

name: Half Guard Bottom: Underhook & Sweep
description: The fundamental half guard game. Secure the underhook, get on your side, and sweep to come on top.

name: Knee Shield Half Guard
description: Defensive half guard position using the knee as a shield to create space and prevent pressure passes.
